FuncDef: This command specifies the import route policy to be used for determining which routes are accepted from peers. Route policies are configured in theconfig>router>policy-optionscontext. When an import policy is not specified, BGP routes are accepted by default.
CLIs: import { join-policy | register-policy } <policy-name> [ <policy-name> <...> <(> up to 5 max <)> ]

ParaDef.Info: Use this command to filter PIM join messages which prevents unwanted multicast streams from traversing the network.

This keyword filters register messages. PIM register filters prevent register messages from being processed by the RP. This filter can only be defined on an RP. When a match is found, the RP immediately sends back a register-stop message.

The route policy name. Allowed values are any string up to 32 characters long composed of printable, 7-bit ASCII characters. If the string contains special characters (#, $, spaces, and so on), the entire string must be enclosed between double quotes. Route policies are configured in the config>router>policy-options context.

ExtraInfo:
Default: no import join-policy
no import register-policy
